headline: Janet's Rich Banana Bread
description: This moist banana bread is made with sour cream and sliced bananas to guarantee tender results and a concentrated banana flavor in every bite.

video.description: See how to make super-moist banana bread.
video.name: Janet's Rich Banana Bread

name: Janet's Rich Banana Bread

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x5-inch loaf pan.

Stir sugar and melted butter together in a large bowl. Add eggs and vanilla; mix well. Combine flour, baking soda, and salt; stir into butter mixture until smooth. Fold in banana slices, sour cream, and walnuts; transfer into the prepared pan.

Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of the loaf comes out clean, about 1 hour. Cool loaf in the pan for 10 minutes before inverting onto a wire rack to cool completely.

review.reviewBody: This is an extremely moist bread. Simply delicious!
New go-to recipe!! Only had vanilla greek style yoghurt so used instead of sour cream and it was SO GOOD!!! Love this recipe!
cook this all the time!!! Absolutely love this recipe!! You won't be disappointed
Made as directed and it was great! Even my non-banana loving child loved it! Definitely a keeper!! My new favorite banana bread.

This is a solid recipe in terms of measurements/amounts that yielded a moist, not-too-sweet loaf. Based on my personal preference and on what some others said in the reviews, I did mash up the bananas rather than using slices. It worked beautifully (although I'm sure the original slices work just as well). I also added a quarter cup of grated dark chocolate and put turbinado sugar and finely chopped nuts on top before baking to enhance the crust. Will keep this recipe for sure.
Very simple instructions prior to the rewards of eating this moist, delicious bread!

First of all, let me say that I have made hundreds of banana breads over the years but my search for the perfect recipe has come to an end! I followed the recipe exactly with two minor modifications. I increased the amount of bananas to five… Yes, five. I mashed up 4 1/2 of them and saved half of one for the top of the loaf. I added a half a cup of the mini chocolate chips if I had had walnuts, I would’ve added that but alas I was out. This loaf came out beautifully. Rich and moist and now I have only myself to blame for not making two. I took 1/2 of one banana and sliced it, placing the individual “coins“ into the top of the batter along the center. Then drizzled honey, across the top of the batter before baking it.

This banana bread is so delicious, it practically melts in your mouth. I just got done making a double batch about 20 minutes ago, and had a warm slice with butter. I made the recipe as is except I mashed the bananas instead of slicing them. I cooked it for 55 mins (my oven sometimes bakes faster than instructions say.) The crust on it sets it apart from other banana breads. My go to used to be the banana split banana bread recipe on this website, but this one is a lot simpler. Both are amazing!
Best ever! And I've been cooking banana bread for 50 years, so that's saying a lot!
This one of my favorite recipes! My family always eats half the loaf before it is even cool. I always double the recipe for left overs and will toss some mini chocolate chips in when I have them.
Very good! I mashed the bananas and added some chocolate chips.
This is the best, most moist and delicious banana bread we have ever eaten! My husband has to have a fresh loaf every week for his breakfast to take to work! I glaze the top with honey before baking.
Best Banana Bread recipe - EVER!!!!!!!!!
Absolutely delicious!
Delicious. Swapped white sugar for half and half with brown and lots of chopped pecans. So moist and stored really well. Yuuuuuum!
Added one more banana mashed - the whole family enjoyed.

So dlicious. I replaced sour cream with an almost half C whole plain yogurt & 2 heqvy Tbs. Cream cheese. I live in upper altitude so i also added 2Tb flower. After cooling when youre ready to serve, generous butter & crack some seasalt over it. . Soft, cooked hrough and moist with a bit of browning in the edges- heavan.

I love this recipe. I make it all the time. I cut the sugar in half though. And I've started replacing 1/3 of the flour with ground flax. And I use toasted pecans instead of walnuts. Oh, and I mash the bananas really well
Great recipe. I have made this twice. Mashed the bananas the first time, sliced them the second time. It is good either way.

It works with yogurt or German quark instead of sour cream. I mash the bananas instead of just slicing as my kid wouldn't like the goopy bits. I top it with a drizzle or brushed on layer of melted chocolate to turn it into a kids' birthday cake. :)
Absolutely delicious!
Best recipe around!
This is the best banana nut bread I have ever baked or tasted. My family loved it!
This is sooooo good! I have gotten nothing but rave reviews from anyone that has tried it. Super easy to make also!

This is my family and friends all time favorite!! Someone is always requesting Janet’s Rich Banana Bread. I substitute the sour cream with one 6 oz Chobani Greek plain yogurt , only bc I always have yogurt in house , never sour cream Lol. Mashing the bananas also work better for me. Absolutely delicious 💯

I made a few changes: used 1/2 cup each of: arrowroot powder, almond flour and all-purpose flour. Added about 1/3 cup of honey and about 3T karo syrup (would have used molasses if I'd had it) and for the eggs, Simple Truth Organic Plant Based Egg Replacer. I used Splenda rather than sugar (diabetic). Threw in nutmeg, and instead of nuts I used peanut butter/chocolate/caramel chips. Very moist! Tastes wonderful!!!
This turned out very moist. I used 2 old bananas we had in the freezer so slicing was out of the question but followed the directions as written. Saving this one for next time.
I've tried multiple banana bread recipes and this one is by far the best. Made extra loaves for the neighbors, and they all either asked for the recipe or praised it.
I Use this recipe as a start for my Banana bread! I use 3 large bananas (mashed) and Greek yogurt instead of sour cream. Turns out perfect every time! Moist and delicious.
Nice and moist but way too sweet. Will make again with half the sugar.
It was very good and my new go to recipe. I have also tweeked it a little by mashing my very ripe bananas and adding Chocolate chips instead of nuts.
took off 1 start just bec i didnt liked the sliced bananas part i wish it was mushed a little as they collected in the mid and bottom half of the loaf
Excellent. Turns out good every time.

This banana bread is absolutely divine!! I mashed the bananas, skipped salt and baking soda and used choc chips in place of walnuts. I also halved sugar as we don't like our cake too sweet. Crusty outside and very moist and fluffy inside. I also creamed butter and sugar first. Best banana bread I have ever made!
This came out great! I wanted a spongy bread and this recipe succeeded!

This recipe is almost perfect. It is SO good! The first time I made it exactly as directed (except I mashed the bananas as others recommended). This time I mashed 4.5 bananas and used that, almost a full cup of walnuts, and added a 1/2 tsp of cinnamon. That made it Exactly what I wanted. It's moist and super flavorful. Will definitely keep making!

This is a great hit for me. I use white+brown sugar half n half and mash bananas. I add black raisins and chocolate chips. I always have to make double the amount. One loaf gets finished at once. Thank you for sharing.
Best recipe! My kids love it. Used this recipe several times and it is always great.
Very moist
Very good. Perfect sweetness... Just a great balance. Turned out unbelievable first time. Very easy as well.
Sooo good! I tried other recipes but this one is perfect.

Oh great… now my neighbors and friends will ALWAYS want me to make this. 🤣😋🍌🍞 Didn’t have walnuts so used some praline pecans and OMG! Next time might try the ones that have a little cinnamon in them… PRO TIP#1: Loosely cover the loaf with foil the last 15 minutes of the bake to prevent over browning. PRO TIP #2: If you’re feeling indulgent, make yourself some French Toast with a couple slices 😋

I made this recipe with the helpful suggestions of those giving feedback. I creamed the butter with the sugar , mashed the bananas, and added 1 tsp cinnamon. This recipe is wonderful. all the ingredients integrated beautifully and were very tasty. Thank you!
Everybody could not stop raving about this recipe when I brought it in to work. Such a good one!!! Thank. You. JANET!
Easy, moist and doesn't take much time. This is the 2nd time I used this recipe and I used a Bundt cake pan.
Made it just as it is but doubled it so I had two loaves and I did add 1 tsp. of cinnamon. Loved it!!
Best banana bread I’ve ever tried, and I’ve tried many. The sour cream is the key!
Loved this one. I added 1/2 tsp almond extract & used shaved almonds instead of walnuts or pecans Nice little change up Banana Bread. You won't be disappointed with this recipe

I wanted some comfort food and had ripe bananas in the house. So, I thought banana bread. I love this recipe! It's very easy and simple to make, and the ingredients are most likely in all our cupboards already. Instead of walnuts, I used pecans (what I had in the house...lol) and I added semi-sweet chocolate chips. YUM! To ensure the chocolate chips were evenly spread throughout the bread. I poured half the batter in the pan, then sprinkled the chips and pushed (w/finger) in the batter, then poured the rest of the batter and added the remaining chips on top and pushed them in. The amount of chips is at your discretion (smile). The result was extremely tasty and comforting. The only criticism I have is the recipe calls for sliced bananas to be added, and the video shows the bananas being smashed and added. I did both. Perfect combo! I got an immersed banana taste and the creaminess of the sliced bananas throughout. Lastly, if you go with sliced bananas, make sure you refrigerate the bread (after it's cooled down), this will keep the sliced bananas from turning brown as you enjoy the bread. slice, toast and butter! Sooo good and comforting!

I give Janet the credit every time I make this banana bread and take it to work. It never ceases to garner emphatic praise as “seriously good”. I simplify the put together process a little by just doing wet ingredients + dry ingredients, increase the banana to 3 and mash instead of slice. You can also sub yogurt for sour cream if you have that handy. Janet! You’re a goddess. Thank you for this bread.
Yummy! The only difference I made recipe with was Very ripe bananas & toffee covered walnuts chopped semi smaller

I loved this recipe, I used 1 cup of flour and 1/2 cup of oat flour and I went half & half white sugar and brown sugar. I used pecans instead of walnuts and this banana bread came out absolutely delicious, very moist.
This is the best banana bread recipe I have ever tried! So moist and delicious . I will never try another recipe. Ms Janet, you are amazing! I hope to see other recipes in the future.❤️
I will never try another recipe again. This is my #1.
It’s my favorite recipe; especially, when the bananas start to turn brown.

It turned out perfectly. I only made a few adjustments. I used nonfat plain Greek yogurt instead of sour cream. I used at least 3/4 of a cup (if not a full cup) of nuts and I used two large mashed bananas instead of medium sliced bananas. Also, I used softened butter, not melted, and I creamed the white sugar and butter before adding the vanilla and eggs. It took exactly 1 hour to cook and it was delish!
I love this recipe. Moist and delicious
This is my go to recipe for when my wife wants banana nut bread (which is often). I make this exactly as suggested in the directions and have never had a bad loaf.

Best banana bread recipe ever! I added nuts to the top as well. Family loves it and I have made it three times in two weeks by demand. I mashed the bananas since I am not a fan of whole slices. Delicious!
STOP! this is the perfect banana bread recipe. I mash the bananas instead of slicing them and it turns out perfectly everytime! I don't do nuts but add chocolate chips! PERFECT!
This is the best banana nut bread ever!
I am not a baker at all but this was just about the easiest recipe ever and just delicious. I had it for breakfast and for dessert at night. I will make it again and again.
Have fixed this multiple times. Always good! Moist and flavorful!
This recipe was the best I have tasted!! My daughter wanted to make it so she did and it turned out great! Just delicious!
Super easy recipe. I took some suggestions from priors bakers and added a little cinnamon and used vanilla Greek yogurt. Will be using this recipe from now on.
Very easy and moist…it’s so delish!!
Any time I have over ripe bananas I make this recipe. No changes. Best banana bread ever! Very moist and flavorful. Even better the second day for some reason.
Came out perfect! I used greek yogurt instead of sour cream!
The recipe came out as great as advertised. I will make this one again.
Love the addition of sour cream (I used "lite"). I added a bit of cinnamon to the ingredients. This came out so moist and delish. New fave!
Perfect. Moist and tasty.

A delicious recipe! I have made it 3 times and each time it is moist and tasty. On one occasion I added chocolate chips along with the walnuts because chocolate and bananas can't be beat. I it was also wonderful.
This is the most moist banana bread. The only change was that I added raisins and put powdered sugar on top to make it look pretty.
This one is definitely a family favorite!

This is a definite keeper. Very moist. I had 3 overly ripe bananas that I put in the freezer (saw this tip from another review). Took them out before i wanted to bake so they could thaw out, cut off the top and squeezed the banana out of peel. Also, add 1 3/4 c. of flour, 1 tsp cinnamon, 1/4 tsp nutmeg, used softened butter not melted and (another review) bc the bananas had been frozen they were already mushy to mix with the butter. Thanks for this recipe! As you can see I havent been able to stop eating it.
Such a great recipe! So moist and great flavour. Highly recommend. My kids even help make it. I usually make a big batch and freeze for latter use.
Excellent! I made this for church, everyone loves it. It freezes well too. Creamy, full of banana flavor. It is the best I have ever made.
Sooo good! Everyone loved it! I’ve tried many banana bread recipes and this is the BEST one!

A perfect recipe which has gotten so much praise for me everytime I make it. It has never gone wrong and has been the star of any get together. I have even replaced white sugar with jaggery powder and white flour with whole wheat flour (atta). The result was still fab and on the top of that - guilt free.
Definitely a 5 star recipe. I make it just about every weekend. Moist and delicious!
soooooo good make it for my family all the time

It got raves. I halved the white sugar and added a half cup of a baking stevia. Per other's suggestion I added a dash or two of cinnamon. For a crumbly topping I added finely chopped walnuts with a sprinkling of turbinado sugar and cinnamon prior to baking.
This is the BEST recipe I have found so far, it has replaced my old favourite! Its a winner with everyone, and the neighbourhood kids!

Super good! A lovely cake/bread. It came out exactly as described. I got this from the article about 5 Best Banana Breads. So far I've made two, both excellent. This is different because of the sliced bananas and a little sour cream. The walnuts I toasted for a few minutes in the oven before chopping and adding. My husband and I agreed that this bread is a little like a good fruit cake, so we enjoyed a slice of it with a tiny glass of cognac! It's also great with a glass of milk.
Unbelievably delicious moist you name it I love this recipe!
Great recipe! I have made it several times exactly as written. Wonderful! The whole family loves it.
Love this recipe, I sub heavy cream for the sour cream sometimes and it is just as tasty. Thanks for sharing.

i didn’t add nuts, and added a bit of cinnamon, and it turned out great! this was my first time making banana bread, or any loaf baked good at all, but this recipe is super easy!! my mom and i both love how it turned out! will definitely be making again!!!

I accidentally only used 1/4c of sour cream but it didn't seem to matter. Maybe because I used 3 small bananas and blended them first, per other reviews. It was delicious! I see more banana bread in my future! Thank you for the lovely recipe!
This banana bread was the best I ever baked I enjoyed it it is very moist and tasteful and I'm going to bake some and take to my friends so they can enjoy it

It’s amazing! Delicious, gooey and soft. Although I followed the instructions perfectly, it was a little bit burned at 30 minutes, so I don’t know if the time should be less or something, but besides that it’s just perfect 💛

Excellent banana bread! I did alter the recipe a slight bit. I put 1/2 C granulated sugar and 1/2 C brown sugar, as well as 1/2 t cinnamon, and pecans instead of walnuts. The recipe makes exactly 4 small loaves which I baked for 35 minutes. Will definitely save this recipe and enjoy gifting the loaves.
really good but dry.

Fantastic recipe. Been looking for the perfect one and this is it. I used canola oil, organic coconut palm sugar, the vanilla flavour and one envelope of Dr. Oetker Vanille Sugar. It didn’t last long. I baked it in 2 loaf pans for 40 minutes. Crystal

I like this banana bread recipe so well; I actually don't want to try others. I just got on here to print it off again miss placed my previous print. It is the best, easy to make and I don't bake really. Do some cooking though. Comfort foods are my favorite to make.

Yum! Went way off the reservation with this one, using craped out on-hand nectarines blended up with a stick blender plus 1/4 cup Splenda rather than bananas. Probably ended up using 2 cups of blended fruit in total (based on how much it looked like banana bread batter all-in. I also subbed in 1C Splenda for the sugar plus, used 1t baking powder as well as the salt and soda called for in the recipe. Other than that, I followed the recipe for blending of dry and wet and did melt the butter. Oh and no walnuts. The Splenda sub chopped 775 calories out as well as 200 carbs out of the recipe. Went from 218 cal/ serving and 27 carbs to 166 and 14. That half a loaf is only 10 minutes old, so very popular. This has to be a bullet proof recipe to be so tasty after all the changes.

I love this bread recipe! I tried swapping the banana for an 8 oz can of pumpkin and added some cinnamon to make a pumpkin Bundt cake and it turned out delicious! So moist! I love you Janet, thank you!!!

This was so good! If anyone knows me, I can't follow recipes exactly...I followed the science part, but fluctuate on flavor. I added a tablespoon of maple syrup to the batter, to give the top a little sugary crisp edge. I only had pecans, so I toasted & rough chopped them, and used them instead of walnuts. I roughly mashed the bananas. And, we love chocolate - so I added about a cup of dark chocolate chips when I folded pecans into the batter. This was so good, so moist! I will definitely be making this again!
Followed recipe and bread is a winner!!
